intro: Plocoglottis foetida, commonly known as the stink vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed. Plocoglottis foetida is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
